sen.j: この寺は、かつて慈照寺（銀閣寺）の場所に浄土寺という天台宗寺院があった。
sen.e: Once there was a temple of Tendai Sect, called Jodo-ji Temple, in the place which is now occupied by Jisho-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple.)

sen.j: この浄土寺の創建年代等については不詳であるが、986年（寛和2年）浄土寺で有明親王（醍醐天皇の皇子）の妃である藤原暁子が出家し、有明親王の子明救（みょうぐ）が入寺している。
sen.e: Though nothing is clear in detail about this Jodo-ji Temple, including the years of its foundation, it is known that FUJIWARA no Gyoshi, the spouse of Imperial prince Ariakira, the son of the Emperor Godaigo, entered the priesthood in this Jodo-ji Temple in 986, and that Myogu, the son of Imperial prince Ariakira, also entered this temple as a priest.

sen.j: その後、、皇室との関係が深かったが、室町幕府8代将軍足利義政が山荘（後の慈照寺銀閣）を建てるにあたり、相国寺付近に移されその後廃絶した。
sen.e: Since then it had kept close relationship with the Imperial families, but was forced to move to the vicinity of Sokoku-ji Temple when the eighth Shogun of Muromachi bakufu, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, constructed his mountain villa which was later called Jisho-ji Ginkaku Temple, on the same site of the Jodo-ji Temple, and subsequently the Jodo-ji Temple was abolished.

sen.j: その浄土寺の跡を引き継ぐにあたり享保年間（1716年～1736年）に建てられたのがこの寺とされる。
sen.e: In the wake of the abolished Jodo-ji Temple, the current Jodo-in Temple was built during the years from 1716 to 1736.
